algorithm_technique: Precomputing last occurrences and iterating to find minimum difference
problem_summary_simple: Count quadruples (i,j,a,b) where substrings are equal and j-a is minimized.
problem_summary_technical: Finds the minimum difference j-a for equal single-character substrings and counts occurrences of this minimum difference.
key_insights: The problem simplifies to finding the minimum difference between the index of a character in `firstString` and its index in `secondString`.
This minimum difference is achieved when comparing single-character substrings.
By pre-calculating the last occurrence of each character in `firstString` and the first occurrence in `secondString`, we can efficiently find the minimum difference.
